reviews.review_msg: I love Dr. Hall. She genuinely made me learn more than I ever have in an INDG course. She also really pushed me outside of my comfort zone to learn more about the specific topics I was interested in. Yes, she is a tough grader but I left this class feeling like I really learned something.

Wenona is a trailblazer, and a great professor. She is a tough marker but If you pay attention to your mistakes your grade will improve. Do the readings, and engage with class contributions. However, her assignments can be confusing so I suggest reaching out to people who previously took this course.

Though assignment guidelines can be unclear and grading is tough, Wenona is an accomplished professor who deeply cares about students actually learning her course material. Taking INDG 301 with her has been the highlight of my fall and INDG minor. While the course is challenging, there's so much to learn if you apply yourself. TAKE IN PERSON.
NEVER take a course with wenona. her criteria was so unclear, and when you didnt fulfill all her criteria (which she didnt make clear at all) you will receive a very low grade.

Prof is hostile and does not create an environment to feel comfortable learning. Criteria for assignments are consistently unclear; if you ask for clarification on assignments, says that you haven't decolonized your mind enough from Western academia. Passive-aggressive feedback, unconstructive. Strong opinions, if you don't agree w her, watch out.

Not a welcoming and kind person. Has strong opinions about certain topics. An uncomfortable and awkward class environment where peers were afraid to participate for fear of having their words changed to reflect different meanings. Calls out someone. No clear justifications for grades and no feedback for improvement. Inaccessible after class hours.

Wenona is knowledgeable. However, she is also rude, hostile at times, and created an uncomfortable learning environment. Her assignment outlines were extremely confusing and unclear, and she did not answer questions clearly. She disregards other Indigenous groups around the world as not as important/relevant as 'local' ones. worst prof i've had.

Wenona isn't bad but she has high expectations. Getting C's on assignments was a norm for many unless you met her eye to eye with course concepts. One of the few profs who was not accommodating during the TA strike. A lot of pressure to be vocal in the course weekly and group work. There were assignments due almost every other week.

Very knowledgeable person. Course outline is quite confusing, out of date, disorganized, and contradictory. She will discuss last-minute requirements for assignments that weren't covered in the syllabus. Expectations are high and is not the most accommodating. Success in her class cannot be attained easily. Avoid unless it's a requirement.
